result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin R. FOX was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
To Steve and Karen Hoefler at 1403 1st Street, Kiel, WI 53042.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes transfer to Sheboygan County Jail pursuant to Manitowoc County rules and defendant is not to be released on electronic monitoring.  (see attached order)
Complete a minimum of one hundred (100) hours of community service each year of probation unless the agent deems it not practical.

It is hereby ordered that the defendant serve his jail sentence as a condition of probation in the Manitowoc County Jail.
Copies to jail and DOC.

The Court has previously ordered the defendant to be able to serve his jail time in Sheboygan County Jail.  The Court also signed an order drafted by the State indicating that all rules of the Manitowoc County Jail be followed, which would prohibit the defendant from electronic monitoring in Sheboygan County Jail.
The parties argue.
The Court modifies the defendant's probation and orders the jail time to be served in the Manitowoc County Jail.

Minutes.
Plea hearing at 05-07-2015 03:30 pm

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 05-05-2015 @ 8:30 a.m. BR-3.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to a Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-20-15 at 10:00 a.m.  Plea date is set for 05-05-15 at 8:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

The Court and the parties have reviewed all reports and agree with the findings that the defendant is competent to proceed in this matter.
The Court has a colloquy with the defendant and finds that he understands what this means.  The Court accepts the parties stipulation of competency and find the defendant competent to proceed.
Upon counsel's request, the Court orders that both report of Dr. Luzi and Dr. Hernke be sealed effective immediately.
Preliminary hearing is set for 02-03-15 at 11:00 a.m.
Minutes.

Request for Adjournment;  Order for Adjournment.
Competency hearing is reset to 01-20-15 at 3:30 p.m.

The Court recaps the case.  In the first evaluation of the defendant, he was found not competent, but could become competent with treatment.  The second report was completed after the defendant underwent counseling and he was found competent to proceed.  The defendant continues to state that he is not competent to proceed in this matter.
Attorney Pozorski asks that an independent examination be completed.  The defendants first appointment is scheduled for 12-01-14.
A review hearing is set for 12-18-14 at 1:30 p.m.  A report should be file one week in advance of this date.
Minutes.
Hearing is reset to 11-24-14 at 3:00 p.m.

Report of Jenna Hernke, Psy.D.
(ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT ON 01-20-15)
Cover letter.
Letter from Nancy Elliott to JLF.

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
Review hearing is set for 12-04-14 at 8:30 a.m.
Fax transmission sheets.

All parties have reviewed the report prepared by Mary Kay Luzi, Ph.D.  
Dr. Luzi finds that the defendant lacks substantial mental capacity to rationally and factually understand his charges, participate in the court proceedings or be of assistance in his defense.  She also finds that he is more likely than not likely to be restored to competency within the permissible statutory timeframe if engaged in competency restoration efforts.
The State stipulates to the findings of Dr. Luzi and asks that the defendant be committed to the Wisconsin Competency Restoration Program for treatment.
Attorney Pozorski also stipulates to the findings of Dr. Luzi and agrees that the defendant is not competent at this time, but that he is likely to regain competency after obtaining outpatient treatment.  The defendant is voluntarily agreeing to treatment and agrees to take all medications as prescribed.
Based on the report of Dr. Luzi and the stipulation of counsel, the defendant lack the capacity to proceed at this time and orders that he undergo treatment through the Wisconsin Forensic Competency Restoration Program.
Minutes.

Report of Mary Kay Luzi, Ph.D., Licensed Psychologist. 
(ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT ON 01-20-15)
Cover letter.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services.
Fax cover sheet and transmission verification sheets.

Attorney Pozorski expresses concerns about the defendant's competency to proceed in this matter and asks the court to order an examination.
State agrees.
Court orders a competency examination to be completed to DHS.  
Hearing is set for 09-03-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Notice of Motion; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.
